p: From the diverse sources of feedstock, within its second generation, waste sauteing oil can be considered as one of the most promising ones. Sauteing oils usually have almost no aggregated value in the market, and its usage as feedstock for biodiesel production contributes to reducing pollution and disposal transportation issues [4]. Nevertheless, one has to consider the high content of free fatty acids (FFA’s) and water, which imposes limitations on the catalytic systems and types of catalysts.
